page.title: 18Law and Order
page.content: Most villages had their own{POLICEMAN} who usually lived in the police house and travelled around the area on foot or on his bicycle. This was the position in Wolvey. The {POLICE HOUSE was situated near the centre of the village on the main road. In recent years the local policeman has been removed and the police house sold, it is now a private house. The village is now policed by using policemen in{PANDA CARS}from the nearby larger village of Bulkington. All 999 calls and administration is dealt with initially at the town of Bedworth. The only permanent police presence in the village is Mr. Hurley who is a { {SPECIAL CONSTABLE.}
